properties.entry: Checks if content node ends with an empty paragraph
Found an empty paragraph at the end of the content node.
Removed empty paragraph from the end of the content node.

This class provides basic Docmenta HTML checks. Following a detailed description of the supported arguments and checks. check:

Arguments:

none

Checks:
trim_empty_paras

This check searches for an empty paragraph at the end of content nodes. If auto-correction is enabled, then an empty paragraph at the end of a content node is removed.

This check can be useful, because some WYSIWYG editors append an empty paragraph, if the cursor is placed at the end of the content.

Following HTML fragments are recognized as empty paragraphs: 

        <p></p>
        <p> </p>
        <p> </p>

trim_figure_spaces

This check searches for whitespace around figures. If auto-correction is enabled, then the whitespace is removed.

A figure is cosidered to be an HTML img element that has a title attribute assigned. In Docmenta, figures should be placed as a single element inside of paragraphs, as shown by the following HTML fragment: 

          <p>
        

        No whitespace should exist between the img and the 
        p tags.
        However, if the content is created by a WYSIWYG editor, then
        whitespace is not visible and may be inserted by mistake.
        This check can be used to automatically remove such whitespace.
        

        

        Note that besides spaces, tabs and line breaks, this check also
        recognizes the character entities   and   as 
        whitespace.
